author: nftdao
title: Decentralized Content Distribution
description: Создатели контента в регионе LATAM испытывают трудности с распространением и монетизацией своего контента.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an incredible proposal. I live in Brazil and I can confirm that the consumption of these contents are huge and, in other hand, the content creators are always complaining about the monetization algorithm and currency variations. 
That said, I think that having another platform which uses an "international" money with a fair pricing and payment methods may impact.

However, my concern is about the overall adoption: 1) There must be an special attention in the user experience of the platform. Since everyone is accustomed in using YT, twitch, etc, the usability of this new platform platform can not change.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is very well written and easy to follow. Since this is a group with a partnership with the University, I conclude that the team involved is quite capable to deliver.
As a suggestion, there could be a more detailed timetable with some milestones in order to allow us to follow the progress. The budget seem fair.

One thing that should be taken into account is the risk associated of short funds. There is the risk that you run out of money and it should have been explored (what to do in this situation?).
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs and metrics are very good. One thing that I should point is the timetable, which is too spaced out in my opinion. In order to be plausible to closely follow it should add more intermediate steps and milestones.

f6_assessments.q0:
Problem statement is clear and idea value proposition makes sense. It would be good to have a local focused platform for NFT exchange removing barriers imposed by big players.
I'd add to the proposal here the platform itself would be maintaned. A lot of the problems stated in the current existing platforms are fees so I understand there will be no fees (or really low ones). Would it be self sustainable/economical viable? How would this allow to offerusers the same quality or similar for the service as big players? Some cost/benefit analysis would be important here.
I liked the start with a pilot/test with key users/companies to check if platform really delivers quality and solves all problems mentioned before opening to major public
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer seems to have enough experience but its not clear how many people are in the team. It will require more than 1 developer. The project leader seems to have enough experience and expertise on developing it but it would be nice to have some linkedin link.

The budget breakdown exists and is sensible.
Theres a general time-framed plan with development, validation/test and roll out of the tool which is essential in a project like this
f6_assessments.q2:
There are good KPIs but they dont have targets which makes it harder to evaluate its success.
 Some milestones could be extracted from the implementation plan but I'd highlight the most important ones in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is consistent with the need of Cardano expansion in Latin America. This proposal impact can be huge due to the amount of content creators in Latin America that would be reached and would have advantages in the decentralized platform.
f6_assessments.q1: Due to the explanation of this proposal and to the professionals that would take part of the project, I think that it wil be successful. The proposer has mencioned UI/UX engineers in the budget and I consider it indispensable to make the platform be a intuitive and successful way to atract and help content creators to reach their goals. The budget and the timeline are clear and coherent. I was born and raised in Latin America, so I would love to see this proposal coming true.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal gives us a breakdown budget, a clear timeline and complete KPI's. This makes the proposal auditable because the people involved in CatalystProject can keep up with the promissed results and the really reached ones. For these reasons, the proposal is easy to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The issue being Latin American Content creators having problem in distributing and monetizing their work. The proposer wants to create a platform for Content creators where they can distribute their work using Non-fundable token and receive payments through ADA.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has all required skills and experience to develop the platform. The proposer had given a complete detailed plan with all the required things and research therefore the it is possible that this proposal will be executed successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has timeline and key performance indicator which will be very helpful to audit the progress and they have given a complete budget breakdown and also a clear roadmap hence with provided will be enough to track the development and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about building a platform for content creators (where they can distribute their creations using NFTs and receive payments over the Cardano blockchain. This is a great idea. The problem is clearly described, and explained in detail with supporting arguments (Language barriers, lack of exposure, Money transfer fees, Censorship,...). The solution is clearly defined with a specific timeline and measurable KPIs.
 
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Team profile is provided and described enough for understanding, with skill, experiences are suitable for implementation + but NO links for verifying each member. There is no demo/pilot yet. The budget is provided in detail. However, KPIs are measurable but not specific, and Risk (and mitigation) is not provided.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a lot of info provided (team profile is provided and described enough for understanding). However, there is no link for verifying each team member, and there is no information on the team's similar works/demo/pilot. KPIs are measurable but not specific, and Risk (and mitigation) is not provided.
Therefore, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to build a platform for content creators where they can distribute their creations using NFTs and receive payments over the Cardano blockchain. In general the approach can obviously work. There is one thing I questioned that if the platform have no centralized actor can ban a content creator based on arbitrary criteria so Is this platform had policy? what if the creator produce harmful the content? or etc...
f6_assessments.q1: While the team has shown relevant experience to demonstrate the skills needed to implement the proposal. However, I would suggest you ad more info and evidence regarding your experience. Like past projects you worked on or a profile site. It is also important to have more detail regarding the number of people involved as a core team.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a budget breakdown. It would be good to add specific numbers as goals for each stage on KPI. I think it should be clear how can be verified the successful implementation of the proposal.

solution: Платформа для создателей контента, где они могут распространять свои творения с помощью НФТ и получать платежи через блокчейн Cardano.
experience:
Когорта 1 Plutus Pioneer, сертификат академии EMURGO, выпускники MIT 2018 Brazil Entrepenurship Bootcamp.
Плюс все ресурсы NFT-DAO.
